conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on each object and use the conditions for equilibrium.
Denote the normal forces exerted by the ground on A and B as N_A and N_B respectively, and the frictional forces as f_A and f_B.
N_A + N_B = 4mg due to vertical force balance.
f_A = f_B due to horizontal force balance.
Maximum static frictional force is given by f_max = mu N.
Coefficient of kinetic friction is mu = sqrt(3)/6.
Center of mass of C is at height R above the ground.
Centers of A and B are at height R above the ground.
Distance between centers of A and B is 2R.
Center of C is directly above the line joining centers of A and B.
Distance from center of C to center of A is R and to center of B is R.
Angle theta that line joining centers of A and B makes with vertical is such that horizontal components of normal forces balance horizontal component of normal force on C.
Normal force on C is N_C = mg.
Horizontal component of normal force on C is mg sin theta.
N_A sin theta + N_B sin theta = mg sin theta.
sin theta = sqrt(3)/2 from geometry.
N_A + N_B = mg due to horizontal force balance.
Contradiction unless considering frictional forces.
f_A = f_B = mg/2 due to horizontal force balance.
N_A = 3mg and N_B = 3mg from frictional force equations.
Normal force F exerted by ground on A is N_A = 3mg.
Frictional force f is mg/2.
Final answers are 3mg and mg/2.
